get.description: Get latest artefact builds of an artefact together with their test executions

get.description: Get latest artefacts optionally by family

schema.title: Response Get Artefacts V1 Artefacts Get
Response Get Artefact Versions V1 Artefacts  Artefact Id  Versions Get

get.description:
Returns a csv report detailing all artefacts within a given date range. Together
with their test executions and test results in csv format.

Returns a csv report detailing all test executions within a given date range.
Together with their artefact and environment details in csv format.

schema.title: Response Get Reported Issues V1 Test Cases Reported Issues Get

get.description:
Returns test cases as a flat list with their template IDs.

Template ID represents the generic test (e.g., "disk/stats_name")
Test case name is the specific instance (e.g., "disk/stats_nvme0n1")
Multiple test cases can share the same template ID but have different names.

schema.title: Response Get Reported Issues V1 Environments Reported Issues Get

get.description: Returns list of distinct environments that have been used in test executions.

Search test results across artefacts using flexible filters.

This endpoint uses a single optimized query with window functions to get both
the total count and paginated results in one database round trip.

parameters.name: issues

schema.description: Filter by Jira or GitHub issue IDs (comma-separated)
schema.title: Issues

parameters.description: Filter by Jira or GitHub issue IDs (comma-separated)

parameters.name: limit

schema.description: Maximum number of results to return
schema.title: Limit

parameters.description: Maximum number of results to return

parameters.name: offset

schema.description: Number of results to skip for pagination
schema.title: Offset

parameters.description: Number of results to skip for pagination

previous_results.title: Previous Results
previous_results.description: The last 10 test results matched with the current test execution. The items are sorted in descending order, the first test result is the most recent, while the last one is the oldest one.
